channel.title: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence
channel.description: Posts from Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: Great commentary from Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Great commentary from Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition on Polis's comments attempting to limit prisoners's access to a COVID-19 vaccine:

"The issue on the table isn’t who is more “deserving” to receive the vaccine but, rather, how to deploy the vaccine as strategically as possible to ensure the health of essential workers, to reduce infection in high transmission environments, and to prioritize those individuals most vulnerable due to age or underlying medical cond...ition.

Over 4,300 incarcerated people have tested positive for COVID, which is 30% of the entire adult prison population, and that figure is surging. To put this in context, if the overall state population had an infection rate of 30%, rather than having 236,000 people who have been infected, it would be over 1.3 million."

https://www.denverpost.com/…/covid-vaccine-colorado-jails-…/

See MoreAt his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…

denverpost.com

Guest Commentary: Jails and prisons direly need vaccines to protect everyone else in Colorado

At his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…At his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…

https://www.denverpost.com/…/polis-covid-vaccine-prison-ja…/

In a position he’s stated twice in the last week, Gov. Jared Polis said he believes incarcerated people should not receive access to upcoming vaccines ahead of free people.

item.title: the government should not and cannot kill our own. ...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

the government should not and cannot kill our own.

https://www.elle.com/…/lisa-montgomery-death-row-execution…/

Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.

elle.com

My Baby Sister Lisa Did a Terrible Thing. We Shouldn't Kill Her For It.

Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.

item.title: pretrial detention or a jail sentence should not be a death...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

pretrial detention or a jail sentence should not be a death sentence. ￼

https://www.cpr.org/…/as-pandemic-worsens-mask-rules-in-ja…/

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.

cpr.org

As Pandemic Worsens, Mask Rules In Jails Vary From County To County

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: #DYK: felony disenfranchisement is a subversive way to silence...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#DYK: felony disenfranchisement is a subversive way to silence the voices of our most vulnerable.

those caged in prisons across our state are banned from voting, but are still counted for census benefits. this is a way the state uses their bodies to support the systems that oppress them while continuing to keep them hidden from view, in horrifying conditions, and away from their loved ones. it must stop.

#CAAPV
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: CPAT is a tool to allow our carceral state to act as it is...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

CPAT is a tool to allow our carceral state to act as it is intended - by disproportionately caging people of color.

https://www.boulderweekly.com/news/analyzing-the-risk/

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

boulderweekly.com

A Denver sheriff deputy used excessive force when he struck a jail inmate in the back of the head with nunchucks and caused the inmate to be hospitalized, Denver public safety officials found.

item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Denver sheriff’s deputy suspended 10 days for crashing car while driving at nearly 4 times legal DUI limit https://www.denverpost.com/…/…/05/denver-sheriff-deputy-dui/

A Denver sheriff’s deputy narrowly avoided being fired for crashing a car into a highway barrier while his blood alcohol content was nearly four times the legal limit.

While nearly all justice is doled out through plea bargaining, none of the district attorney’s offices in the Denver area track the data necessary to know if there are racial disparities in the way…

item.title: "Voters will have a chance to choose who will set the tone...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

"Voters will have a chance to choose who will set the tone for the criminal legal system in their judicial district. With at least half of the seats poised to turn over, the results could alter how — and how quickly — change will come to Colorado’s criminal justice system, which has been the topic of major legislation over the past few years.

“These people matter,” said Juston Cooper, executive director of CCJRC4Action, a nonprofit organization launched in September that advocates on criminal justice policies. “They are the gatekeepers. They are the reason we have mass incarceration and overcriminalization in the state, and in the country.”

#DAsAreCopsToo #CAAPV

At least half of the state’s 22 judicial districts will have new district attorneys on Jan. 1. Every district attorney seat is up for election this year, though many candidates and a handful …

denverpost.com

Half of Colorado’s district attorneys will be replaced after election, setting scene for future of criminal justice reform

At least half of the state’s 22 judicial districts will have new district attorneys on Jan. 1. Every district attorney seat is up for election this year, though many candidates and a handful …At least half of the state’s 22 judicial districts will have new district attorneys on Jan. 1. Every district attorney seat is up for election this year, though many candidates and a handful …
